page.title: 01Horse Riding
page.content: Every Saturday morning I go up to Calveton which is a small village in Nottinghamshire. Where I go to a stable called "St Clements Lodge" which is down a small track called "Woods Lane", near the square. They have 27 horses or ponies there. I have ridden all but five. Three are not ridden because they have Pedagrees and are owned by Nick. Nick is our schooling teacher and we ride for about ten minuites up to a large field and do jumping, fenceing, racing, polo and ordinary riding. There is a beginers lesson where I first learnt to ride. My first horse was called James but now I ride Spring Song. I have never been hunting because I don't believe in it.
